definitions.definition: A long-term respiratory condition, in which the airways may unexpectedly and suddenly narrow, often in response to an allergen , cold air, exercise, or emotional stress. Symptoms include wheezing, shortness of breath, chest tightness, and coughing.

main_definition: ( pathology ) A long-term respiratory condition, in which the airways may unexpectedly and suddenly narrow, often in response to an allergen , cold air, exercise, or emotional stress. Symptoms include wheezing, shortness of breath, chest tightness, and coughing.
